newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian Savings Bank in focus on active bourse.
newsitem.headline: Estonian Savings Bank in focus on active bourse.

text.p: Shares in Estonia's second largest bank, Savings Bank, were in the spotlight on the stock market on Wednesday where business in general was active and the index gained, dealers said.
Trade on the official list came to 11.7 million kroons and the Tallinn stock exchange index rose 0.96 percent to close above the 110 mark at 110.46.
Savings Bank accounted for 3.4 million kroons of trade and closed nearly three kroons higher at 53 kroons.
"There are serious buyers in the market that have a long-term interest," Hansapank dealer Maart Meerits said.
Union Bank was the second most active stock with volume of 3.3 million kroons and it closed slightly higher at 22.25 kroons versus 22 kroons.
Hansapank, Estonia's leading bank, turned over three millions kroons of shares and rose slightly to 107.95 from 107.60 kroons.
The over-the-counter market saw trade of 3.5 million kroons and the Norma plastics maker was again the most traded at 1.6 million kroons closing slightly higher at 29 kroons.
The newest share on the free market, construction group EMV, announced 10 month profits of 11.9 million kroons but dealers said this had little impact on the group's shares.
